page.title: 12Industry continued
page.content: Obsolete brine wells mainly north and east of the old flashes are left with a supporting lintel of rock salt to prevent the collapse of the overlying Keuper Marl and filled with saturated brine to prevent further dissolving, with an air pocket under pressure above. The wells are checked annually to detect subsidence at an early stage. The current brine wells are south west of the flashes. The brine is pumped along pipes beneath the Wyre for use at I.C.I. Hillhouse to give chlorine,sodium hydroxide and hydrogen.The cell rooms have a capacity of 80000 tonnes per year.Almost all chemical manufacture at Hillhouse is based on Preesall brine.
